content: Has anyone had any luck with the DaVinci client reference application for provider/pharmacy since the last HL7 event? I'm still getting the 'too many redirects' error.

@David Clowers Apologies. We have not made progress on this yet. It will be at the top of the agenda after the Carin connectathon event.
@Dave Hill

@Saul Kravitz @Dave Hill Adding this here since it's semi-related and to avoid creating another new topic - will there be an opportunity for those of us implementing DaVinci solutions to participate in Connectathon 26? So far, we have not seen any track information added for Provider or Formulary.
https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2021-01+Connectathon+26
@David Clowers There will be tracks for Provider Directory and Formulary for Connectathon 26. We will be putting up track documentation shortly.

@Saul Kravitz @Dave Hill Our team is attempting to integrate our solution with the client reference application using a local version pulled down from the GitHub repo, but we're still hitting issues both with this version and the web version. When our dev team tries to deploy the application via Docker, we're getting the below error. Any suggestions?

Sorry about that @David Clowers
Our instructions are lacking.
1) you need to install and start Pgsql -- see https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.1/server-start.html
2) you need to initialize zip code database. Run db/seed_zipcodes.rb

We hope to update the documentation soon
@Saul Kravitz Much thanks. I'll pass this along to our devs and we'll see how far we get.
Readme has been updated. Not sure that the docker instructions are in line with these changes.

I see that the instance of the client is back up: https://plan-net-client.herokuapp.com/

Is that based on what's in github under the main branch, or is there another branch/repo being used?

I had several issues running what's out there in main, I was able to after looking at @Saul Kravitz 's comments above, but still it felt like it needed several manual steps, not listed in the readme, to get to that point. Is there an updated set of instructions?

Also, that instance that I was able to run from main appears to be different than the reference instance, in that the reference has an extra couple of menu options on the top Pharmacy Mix and Export.

Unfortunately, it appears that the version that is deployed is the fixPharmacyQuery branch. Apologies.

Comments on the (lack of) documentation appreciated. (via PM or e-mail)
